intro: Agalinis domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Agalinis domingensis is considered endangered and is of interest for conservation efforts.
